author: {'steamid': '76561198052913068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1462847339}
review:
It had good potential but seems to have been abandoned since. 
It hasn't been updated for about 3 years (as of now)
Mechanic wise it was a good concept where what you ate helped you to survive and adapt better in the enviroment.
However there's not much to do or to see in the game and there's not much to figure out as there's very few enemies and adaptations to try.
I still have hope that it'll be updated in the future, but as it stands. Either wait for it to go on sale or to be gifted to you (most likely by someone who doesn't like you cause of how under-developed the game is.) but don't waste your money paying full price for it right now.

review:
Gerade im Multiplayer hätte das Spiel spaß machen können, es wurde an der oberfläche von einem Bausystem gekratzt da war auch schon wieder die luft raus.
Keine Upadest, kaum etwas zu machen... traurig aber auch das hier wird wohl nie zu einem echten Spiel heran wachsen obwohl die Idee sich durch Narung mutieren zu lassen und so das Erscheinungsbild zu verändern und neue fähigkeiten zu bekommen wirklich gut war.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167559933', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1538205170}
review: This game was abandoned two years ago, despite the fact that it hasnt aged well with its following of players being mostly dissapointed by the updates coming to a screeching halt, however this may be heavily opinionated, I certainly believe this game had great potential, but even in its current state, with the multiplayer being a tad buggy and the like, it is still an excellent game, there is no other survival game on the market that uses this formula of mutating your body to adapt and survive, that said it would be an excellent, EXCELLENT surprise to hear this game being picked up by another developer, those on steam who are willing to take up this challenge, I salute you.

review:
I do not recommend this game, it has gone silent and no new updates for a long time.
There is nothing to really do in this game other then to cook meat, and try a couple different evolutions based on what mutations you get by interacting with the world.Should offer about a hour of entertainment but thats about it.Keep an eye on the forum if you are still interested but do not buy into this game until a developer can show signs of still being alive and working on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086707067', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1476405202}
review:
The game needs a lot of improvements, I've had it for quite the long time... stopped playing it before they addded the building houses... I've tried to play it for the past two weeks and waiting for a server to load is aggravating... so far no load, I used to play mostly single player, and on a server with a friend... but now it's painfull to get on. 

Wish they fix this and I'll gladly get on more. I still like this game a lot, even though I only played it for a little while. Just wish some things were sharper too. Characters are cool in my book as well as the mutations idea...

author: {'steamid': '76561197972269258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1450827579}

Game still very much EA. There are lots of concepts which are not fleshed out and the game is clearly not finished. Additionally, the game has not been updated in over 9 months. To further issues the developer has not been around for the same period.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987743391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1448134138}
review:
Cool art design and concept but that's it so far. Game play is fairly non existant right now, mechanics necessary to make it enjoyable to play haven't been implimented. The devs haven't done an update since December 2015 so I'm not sure the devs will put anything in to bring it more to a complete state. The devs were communicative at the start but all of that's kinda evaporated.

It's been well over a year since the last time the devs have made any communication. It's been abandoned, don't buy this. There is far too little content to find any enjoyment in the current product and no hope of it ever becoming more complete.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997356779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1459950246}
review:
It's an alright concept, but it still needs a lot of development to really warrent a purchase. As of right now (August 9th, 2016) the last update was almost 8 months ago (December 18th, 2015.) I'm unsure if the dev is really busy with developing this game, or has disappeared. Their last post ever on the steam forums was January 14th. Will be a good game if it's ever completed, but right now everything looks a little shakey with no Dev presence anywhere (Even their twitter, website, and facebook have been neglected and untouched since December/January.) So to avoid any heart ache and rage, avoid the game for now. (I'll definitly change my review after I find some trace of recent dev activity.)

edit: Okay, new edit. They're dead, Jim. Facebook ( https://www.facebook.com/immersivedouro/ ) and Twitter ( https://twitter.com/immersivedouro ) haven't been updated in almost a year, "Official Forums" ( http://projectshrooms.com/forum/viewforum.php?f=2&sid=ff06827f53b28783ff3c8d0570ee0e46 ) is so choked out with bot spam that there isnt even a point in opening any topic. The developer who initially posted Shrooms on Reddit has been innactive for 7 months (1 year if you only count information pertaining to Shrooms), and their main business page ( http://immersivedouro.com/cgi-sys/suspendedpage.cgi ) appears to have been repossessed by the web host (HostGator.) The three devs I know about have been either innactive or just playing games on Steam, most likely with the money gained from Shrooms. I had hopes that the developers would suddenly return and prove me wrong, but it sucks to be proven right.

Update from the Devs themselves! Apparently they had been fired and their employer chose to leave this game up on Steam while (possibly) hiring new devs who may or may not continue work on this game. I have a feeling this was the last nail in the coffin. Game is dead. Never forgetti rest in spaghetti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031127696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1451930516}
review:
Nicht zu empfehlen.

Zuerst das wichtigste: EA. Das heisst, es kann sich noch alles zum besseren wenden.

Warum kann ich es nicht empfehlen?
 
1.) User Interface. Die Menüs sehen aus wie eine vt100 Console mit  Schriftgröße 50px
2.) Content: Es gibt sehr wenig davon.
3.) Bedienung: Unintuitiv par excellence.
4.) Speichern? Fehlanzeige.
5.) Grafik: Sehr schlechte fps (ca. 20fps), trotz altbackener Grafik (Erinnnert an ein Spiel aus 2003 (sieht auf den Screenshots interessanterweise besser aus, als im Spiel selbst) auf einem Rechner, der Skyrim mit ENB auf 50fps schafft

Zusammengefasst würde ich sagen: Derzeit ist es wenig mehr als eine Tech-Demo (die aussieht als wäre sie aus dem Jahr 2003). 
Es stecken gute Ideen dahinter, ich wage jedoch zu bezweifeln, dass dieses "Spiel" sich noch ins positive wenden wird.

review: An incredible interesting idea though still in very very early creation. it also seems highly in need of description for almost everything ingame. If your interested in this title id suggest keeping it on watch, it is still too early for a purchasable game. even on sale the price tag just does not justify payment for such an early access program. I had trouble even playing it for the first week after i had purchased it, then miraculously it started working. Id like to see this one developed further though i think i may wait awhile before i try playing it again. Extremely rough around the edges with an amazing amount of potential. id love to recommend this game, though at its current state of developement i cannot recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107803309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1435880514}
review:
[i]Key supplied by developer for review.[/i]
[h1]======================================[/h1]
[h1][b]Shrooms[/b][/h1] (Read on for the full review!)
[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]

Shrooms is definitely an alpha, but a unique one with fun and potential! Give it a buy if you're hopeful, or maybe hold off and see where it goes for a while if you're unsure.

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1][b]Pros[/b][/h1]
+Gameplay: Unique and interesting, barebones but good survival elements.
+Graphics: Exotic level design, variable player model.
+Audio: Sparse, but functional, good ambience.

[h1][b]Cons[/b][/h1]
-Couldn't go above 25FPS on any setting.
-Interface slightly clunky.
-Forest seems to be a deathtrap.

[h1][b]Neutral[/b][/h1]
+/-Slightly finicky targeting issues.

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1][b]Introduction[/b][/h1]

Hello and welcome to this review of Shrooms, a game where you...eat shrooms! Wait, wait, that's not all there is to this, you eat shrooms to alter your body which changes the way you interact with the world! There are critters, monsters, basic crafting, and survival elements brought into the mix!

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]

There's only so much to Shrooms right now, but what's there is good! So for every shroom you eat, it alters a part of you from the head, arms, legs, or your torso. This gives them different effects or passives such as but not limited to: invisibility, damage absorption, damage reflection, a high damage punch, longer underwater time, etc. This will allow you to interact with the world and its inhabitants in different ways. A refreshing and fun game concept!

The general gameplay will have you running around collecting ingredients so that you can make tools so that you can more efficiently gather ingredients (or better ones) so that you can fight, keep warm, or stock up on bow ammo. Basically, you're doing what you have to to survive and eating mushrooms to help along the way!

[h1][b]Graphics[/b][/h1]

The graphics, while good, could use some improvement, especially given the FPS I get.
The environment design is exotic and unique, with a lot of glowing lights and unique land and rock formations, pretty water, and vegetation.

The UI is a bit large, but in terms of design seeks to be minimal, and currently could use a facelift. Getting around it is easy enough once you get used to it, though, with simple hotkeys, and everything spelled out conveniently in non-distracting places.

[h1][b]Audio[/b][/h1]

There isn't much there, but the ambience is nice, and the sounds your character makes sufficies with no crack or pop in the recording. For what they are, they're actually believable, too, which is nice.

[h1][b]Conclusion[/b][/h1]

All in all, in its current state, Shrooms is fairly barebones, but imaginative and unique, and it deserves credit for that. Unique player models for the mutations is a nice touch, which indicates not only time spent but love given. The survival elements are a nice touch, but lack commonalities to make them worthwhile, such as the ability to build a shelter. The world also feels a bit empty currently, with only two other critters to run into. An armadillo and panther. It's easy to envision this game becoming something great, however, and time will tell if the developers get it there!

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197963799987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1434044987}
review:
I started off as Big-Booty-Judy, enjoyed Judy's booty. Gathered some supplies, made a fire, and hunted animals etc...

Then I started experimenting with the shrooms/weeds. I grew horns, slung webs, shot a laser with my eyes, and swam like a fish.

Got overzealous and took too many shrooms. Started having psychedelic vision changes. Enjoyed Judy's Booty in psychedelic colors.

If this game had more variety/less bugs it could be a 10/10. As is - in early alpha stages - it's a 7/ or 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094878517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1439708319}
review:
[h1]Shrooms is in EARLY ACCESS and it's Alpha Build can be subject to changes![/h1]

[b]This review will be updated with every new patch that Immersive Douro introduces into the Alpha.[/b]

Shrooms looked interesting in the trailer, and I thought that the devs were just playing with a female avatar instead of a male one because they preferred the sexy booteh, but I was wrong. Devs are WORKING on a male avatar... right? D:

Anyway, I had a blast getting lost in the game and being immersed in a words filled with shrooms and where biomes seem to be condensed into one small area. That was confusing and I really did not understand what was happening, but it was fun regardless. Harvesting, crafting and inventory confused me alot, because my mind has been hardwired to using the left and right clicks, the E key, etc. This is rather fresh, but can be infuriating at times. Using an item is very time-consuming and sometimes even infuriating(I'm looking at you, items that don't stack).

While it may seem I dislike the game, surprisingly, I do not. I enjoyed it, despite the limited possibilities I had. If the devs continue to add more into the game and work on it, I'm pretty sure it'll become something more.

If you do not like Early Access games, this might not be the game for you.

[u]So far, I've only discovered a few bugs[/u]:
[list]
[*] That certain Shrooms, such as the Berserker Torso Shroom and Swimmer MainHand(?) Shrooms don't stack, making consuming them difficult.
[*] I run an i7 processor, GTX860M graphics cards, but I've been having issues with the gameplay, namely delays and whatnot. I have no idea if this is just my machine running crudely or if it's the Alpha stages of the gameplay(Everyone else seems to be running fine).
[*] Falling from high ground sometimes does not register fall damage, specially when you end up falling on a slope.
[*] Diving down to the river floor can sometimes cause you to be stuck. The Character treats the river floor as a contact surface and walks around normally, while the oxygen level continues to drop.[/list]

[u]My suggestions are:[/u]
[list]
[*] Add Male Gender to be available (I know you guys are working on that Immersive Douro!)
[*] Maybe Character Customization?
[*] The ability to instantly craft an item when you have all the components instead of tediously clicking on the item to add it into the crafting layout.
[*] Character's interaction with his/her surroundings and environment. I noticed that the character fans herself when in the desert, but she doesn't shiver in the cold. It would also be nice to see the character interact with his/her environment, such as using hands to balance when climbing up a mountain/ steep slope.
[*] A tutorial to explain certain aspects of the game, I was really confused by the Build Item minigame/mechanic.
[*] Retweak the animations to look more natural. Movements are exaggerated, especially both the character and the Panther's attacking animations. Panther seems to continue attacking even if the character is down.
[*] Remove the numbers above the character that indicates increases or decreases, etc. Or at least until it's been worked out properly. Sometimes the numbers are seen flipped, it could potentially confuse the players. And if numbers are added, coding it so that each number appears to their respective players, or else the server will crop up with number everywhere when players enter a full out PvP battle royale.
[*] Add armor/clothing crafting options, as well as maybe the ability to build settlements.
[*] Maybe a few NPCs?[/list]

For a 1hr full of nonsense commentary and word fumbling, looping of sentences; please make yourself acquainted at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=30GUj5zeSyU

author: {'steamid': '76561198009526542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1431331856}
review:
Pour faire simple ce jeu promet beaucoup mais donne peu pour l'instant.

Il coute moins de 15€ certes mais le contenu actuel ne les vaut pas. Pourtant, les devs sont honnêtes et explique que c’est une EARLY EARLY ALPHA. 

Le jeu est sorti hier soir et propose déjà une map sympa, un système de survie et craft de base, suffisant pour poser les bases d'un bon jeu. 

Acheté, testé, approuvé !!!


[h1]I-/ Le gameplay[/h1]

Rapidement explorée, la map présente tout de même 6 biomes différents, et les contours sont délimités par des montagnes (ou murs invisibles dans la mer ^^).
Les ressources à farm sont présentes et les monstres aussi la nuit venue. Un système de craft intuitif et efficace, cependant quand il s’agit de Moder son corps là vient la difficulté.

Le gros intérêt du jeu, réside dans les modifications possibles sur votre corps. Pour résumer, chaque biome à ses ressources que vous pourrez utiliser pour modifier votre corps. Chaque ressource, modifie une partie de votre corps (torse ou jambes…) avec un effet particulier (meilleur à la nage ou au sprint…).
Il faut tout de même prendre attention aux toxines liées à ces modifications afin de ne pas perdre de la vie… ;)

[h1]II-/ Graphismes et ambiance sonore.[/h1]

Franchement, le jeu est en early access, et pourtant il n’est pas moche contrairement à d’autres. L’univers coloré et la bande son vous mettent bien dans l’ambiance. Et lorsque la nuit venue, vous êtes surpris par une panthère affamée, courez loin vers la lumière.
Je vous invite à aller voir mes screens sur mon profil pour plus d’infos^^

[h1]III-/ Les bugs ou autre éléments temporaires gênants.[/h1]

Comme précisé sur la page du jeu, il n’y a à l’heure actuelle pas de possibilités de sauvegarder. Ainsi, tout arrêt d'une partie en cours (serveur distant ou local) vous vaudra de redémarrer entièrement.
Ce n’est pas vraiment un bug, mais prenez garde à votre endurance !!! Si elle tombe à 0 vous ne pouvez plus nager et du coup vous coulez… xD Le bugs réside dans le fait que votre endurance à un comportement bizarre tendant à se vider ou se remplir sans vraiment de raisons parfois.

[h1]IV-/ Et la suite ?[/h1]

Et bien par la suite, les devs vont en premier mettre en place un système de sauvegarde, puis augmenter les crafts et nombres de mutations possibles. Après ils vont voir pour le système de construction puis … je ne suis pas dans les confidences des devs, mais ça sera un bon vieux survie/craft/construct façon science-fiction.

[h1]V-/ Conclusion.[/h1]

Si vous voulez aider ce jeu, alors n’hésitez pas achetez le. 
Si vous vous sentez réticent pour le moment, attendez quelques maj pour gagner en contenu en espérant que le prix n’augmente pas entre temps^^
Enfin, n’ayant pas implémenté de tuto dans le jeu, les devs ont quand même pris le temps de créer un guide en anglais sur leur site disponible ici http://projectshrooms.com/guide/

author: {'steamid': '76561198004011377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1431639272}
review:
Shrooms takes a fresh and very different approach to the survival and exploration genre.
To survive, it doesn't just matter what you craft or the items you have, it also matters who you are!
Experimenting with different combinations of plants and mushrooms, figuring out what they do and how can you use them, seeing how they affect your cute character and the beautiful environment wich you are in... Can't wait for more!
Keep in mind that this is an Early Acess game and if you don't know what that means then [url=http://store.steampowered.com/earlyaccessfaq/] read about it here [/url].
The game has a lot of potential and I can't wait to see what kind of updates and new features will be rolling out soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010024933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1448244206}
review:
Very cool but very rough Early Acess game. It's a typical open world survival game in the same vein as Minecraft and Rust, but with the unique mechanic of beng able to mutate your character with various fungi and give them special abilities.

So far, the game doesn't expalin any of its mecahnics which makes things confusing- I can't figure out what mutations give me what abilities and how to activate them, and I have no idea how to restore my health (I think eating some food restores it but some doesn't???). [There is actually a guide to the game that the devloper helpfully linked to in the comments for this review, qhich certainly helps.] The game has a crafting system, but it's limited so far and there's a laggy minigame involved that doesn't really seem to affect the outcome. It's also very easy to die accidentally, whether by starving to death (there's a food meter under your health meter, and when that runs out you die instantly) or by the angry panthers that will chase you across the entire map.

All that said, still a neat game, interesting unique mechanics, cool environment to mess around in, all in all a promising foundation, very clearly in alpha but with a lot of potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999342177', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1431013858}
review:
[h1]Shroom Early Access – A Steam Review[/h1]

[i][Disclamer - I was provided a copy by the publisher for review purposes][/i]

[b]The good[/b]

[list]
[*]Interesting gameplay ideea, with the posiblity to become a nice Minecraft-type game for people that like doing shrooms
[*]Crafting with a nice mini-game twist
[/list]
[b]The not so good (take everything with a grain of salt, the game is in Alpha):  [/b]
[list]
[*]No tutorial. I just spawned in the map and got killed by 3 tigery-black-panthery things.
[*]The controls feel a little bit clunky, but I blame it on the Alpha.
[/list]
[b]The conclusion: [/b]

If you get onto the early access, don't expect much, the game is still in the very early stages of development. Despite that, the idea of eating stuff to modify your body is pretty nice and it keeps you engaged for a while. Unfortunatelly, I wasn't able to check the multiplayer, but the single player was pretty interesting. This is a game that has a good potential of becoming a great game. 

You can see me playing it here - http://youtu.be/bpcGFrG28Bk

But i did fool a bit around with the game, crafted some equipment, harvested some resources and ate some shrooms that mutated me :)
